My little cat which I had raised all by myself, hanged itself when  
playing in the garden.

At school a classmate who was a very good pupil had to help  
another boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose the  
wrong things so that he had to repeat a year.

When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her  
feel hurt.

I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontment  
but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayed  
holiday job.

I have a boyfriend and I am very fond of him. When we had our  
"11-months jubilee", I had forgotten it. But he gave me a red  
rose.

When I was a child I was afraid of big dogs. One day when I came  
home a big dog was laying in front of our door. I was so  
frightened that I did not dare to enter the door and I waited  
until somebody passed by.

I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could  
not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the  
University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it  
finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at home  
she called me to tell me that she would stay the night with her  
boyfriend.

When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His  
legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I  
came into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A few  
days later he died.

When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he had  
big problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle of  
the night and shouted at me.

At school I was bad in mathematics. Although my teacher had  
admonished me to do my homework, one day I had forgotten to do  
it. When my teacher noticed it, I blushed and was ashamed to be  
rebuked in front of the other pupils.

When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister.  
Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried  
and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.

After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurried  
home hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feeling  
his body.

One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the ground  
floor, I was often afraid of burglers.

One day, when riding on a bicycle path, a car coming from the  
opposite direction forced me to get off my bike although I had  
the priority.

My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainly  
would have liked to live longer. I was also said because I was  
confronted with the fact that I would die one day too.

One day, when I was twelve years old, my brother took some slimy  
substance swimming on the surface of a pot of vinegar made of  
cider and threatened to throw it at me.

When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I had  
told him that my father had retired.

I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I  
had wanted to.
A party with friends on New Year's Eve.

When I was hitch-hiking and I went with a man who drived like a  
madman.

I was in "Hainburg" in December and I was angry about the  
politicians and the police.

I met again a very good friend after a year and realized that  
there had grown a certain distance between us.

When I listened to a conversation of friends talking about the  
power of money.
When my grandmother died - at her funeral.

I read about a monk who had been murdered and put into a barrel  
which was filled with blood of pigs.

I went for a walk with a very close friend; we were talking about  
our problems, I told her lies.

I had to tell a collegue the time for an appointment with another  
collegue. I told her the wrong time - it was obviously my fault.

I went to buy a bicycle with my father. When I wanted to pay, my  
father took his purse and payed.

My mother had fallen down from a ladder when she had been  
gathering cherries. Her back was hurt. Just when I arrived, I saw  
people of the life-saving service giving her medical care.

I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parking  
place, because I wanted to park my car there. Because of uncoming  
traffic I had to wait for a short time - another driver placed  
his car on the place.
My partner left me after we had been together for a long time.

At a discussion a friend took a "faschistic view", what I had not  
expected.

At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I was  
prevented from participating in several activities.

When I was driving my motorbike I went into a bend incautiously  
and fell down. I was slightly hurt, the motorbike was slightly  
damaged.

Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop could  
not consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a big  
surprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Our  
relationship grew closer.

When I was a child, I fell into a cellar (when playing) and could  
be freed only with big difficulties.

I was angry about several drivers who showed an aggressive and  
dangerous driving habit.

When my grandmother died. I had a very deep relation to her (I  
lived with her for several years).

Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my  
part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly  
she did not give up for a longer time.

When I went to the sauna for the first time and there were men  
and women.

When I was parking my car I was not cautious and bumped into  
another car. I caused considerable damage. The driver of the  
other car was very angry and I let him insult me because I felt  
guilty.

A person whom I had not seen for a long time called me and  
invited me for a party.

When I was walking on the street, a group of drunk, bawling young  
people approached.

When I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I would  
have liked, too, because he heaped a floot of words on the  
letter.
When my grandmother died.

When I shoplifted a pair of earrings from Coles and my Mum caught  
me with them in my bag.

When my mother was tremendous on the phone and we talked for  
hours. She was in a good mood.

When I saw a good male friend unexpectedly after a year, as I've  
just returned from overseas. I was feeling tired, looking a mess,  
and nervous.

When I wanted to talk to someone I liked and whom I have been  
told likes me (by his brother and even by himself) however he  
avoids any confrontation, and is vague.

After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of  
support and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.

When a boy had continued to use foul language and swearing in  
front of a group of my friends.

When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a  
doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.

Feeling guilt after greed, buying chocolate and pigging out to  
the point of feeling sick, especially as I am fat.
When planning to marry.

No really strong such emotion. Just falling off to sleep when I  
caught sight of a 5 cm diameter spider crawling onto the pillow  
beside me.

My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in  
recent broken relationship.

Recent break-up of seriors long-term relationship, helped along  
by would-be  in-laws.

No very strong such emotion. Treatment of my sister by her  
dancing instructor - he is a "user", i.e., takes advantage of her  
good nature.

After failing a second attempt at Med 4, following a number of  
difficult personal circumstances.

Failure to complete medical course as a result of failing fourth  
year twice.

When Wayne and Sue (close friends) were announced our guardians  
at ther wedding.

Car accident nearly occurred between us and drunk driver coming  
in opposite direction it missed us by approx 1 m and collided  
(after rolling twice midair) into nearby scrub.
When boyfriend lied to me.
When my boyfriend took me to his father's grave.

On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years)  
cigarettes.
When harassed by this boy - it was sexual (refer to GUILT).

When in grade 3, late home from school every day for weeks  
because of harassment from a grade 7 boy I lied to mother about  
why I was home late.
Getting a part-time job.

Small car accident. Black ice on the road - cars in front of us  
started zig-zagging and so did we. Car in front did a 180 turn we  
followed and ended up in a gully.
People hunting animals.

When my grandfather was sick, and died I felt more sad, though,  
when he was sick.
People spitting in railway stations.
Falling over.

Eating too much I felt guilty afterwards because I knew I  
shouldn't have overeaten as I'm putting on too much weight.

When my last year's second semester results came through - I was  
ecstatic.

I was sleeping in my room but woke in the middle of the night to  
think I could hear noises and see shadows moving. I felt that  
someone was in the house.

At school, a couple of years ago, a so-called acquaintance told lies  
about me to a teacher I was told about it by friends who overheard  
the conversation.

My grandfather died. He lived almost as a recluse not caring for  
himself as well as he should - Dad and we all helped as much as  
we could, but it didn't save him from himself. It was an  
unexpected death. His second de facto wife was lucky she wasn't  
jailed.

In my penultimate job I was responsible of a sections with  
several employers, after several years of dedication I was  
dismissed by a new chef, saying that I was incompetent.

I assisted to a scene where the police attacked a person that  
didn't have his documents. The savagery was too much, and the  
attacked person bleeded to much.
In a party of friends I got completely drunk.

Once in my homes yard, I was plaing football with my cousin and  
in a certain quick the ball went on uncontrolled putting down a  
bird-cage, killing it.

When I get something that seemed very hard like getting a job, a  
boyfriend, etc. A specific sutuations, was when I started to date  
a boy whom I liked for a long time.
When I had to assume a position which I didn't expect.

When I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked,  
because there where persons that didn't have problems, and  
wouldn't miss in the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.

I felt very sad when I had to give up something that by right was  
mine and although I didn't get it, a kind of suvenir that people  
don't give you the right to have.

The acts of brutal violence in generally disgusts me. Fights,  
phisical aggrssion, etc.

I felt ashamed when in a certain occasion I had to read a text  
and didn't stop stuttering.
When I was reproved eighth grade of high school.

When I talked with a teacher yesterday who, to say the least, was  
rude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.
The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.

In a sexual experience with an unknown woman where after the  
sexual act I only could go away without looking backwards.
When I wanted to kiss a friend and didn't succeed, I felt shame.

On a telephone talk where I was agressive and stupid without the  
least, reason or better motive.

When I succeed in writing something I felt and doing it I felt  
well and very happy for being able to express to myself something  
that was suffocating me.
When I crashed my car.

When in a difficult moment I couldn't express myself correctly  
and my thought came out with distortions bringing about highly  
negative and distorted results.

When I heard about the death of somebody I liked very much and I  
was not present either to see the person or to try to share my  
emotions with other friends.

When I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hide  
how she hated herself for not having the will power to get out of  
such a situation because it was convenient, according to what she  
told me.

When somebody suddenly said something (about me) at a wrong  
moment and I didn't agree (at that exact moment I was needing an  
extremely positive word).
When my mother surprised me while masturbating.

I forgot to water the flowers in our flat and was rebuked by my  
friends who share the flat with me.

After my final examination at school I was glad that the  
examination was over and that I had passed it.

When I was a child, I had a nightmare. At that time, I was not  
yet able to tell anybody about it, so I was very frightened. I  
could not explain myself all that and I had to deal with it by  
myself.

I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a ball  
offending her relatives.

When my grandfather died. When I heard about his death, I had a  
bad feeling in my stomach and I felt as if I had lost something  
very precious.
My brother caught a spider and let his frog eat it.

Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite a  
nonsense.

I was not sure whether I should help an old woman going down a  
flight of stairs. I just watched her and saw how difficult it was  
for her to do it.

For about one year I had a rather bad relation with my father.  
Last Christmas Eve he invited me to stay withhim and I was very  
glad about it. It was a fine evening.

I live outside Graz - so I have to go by bus. One day I went home  
from the bus stop alone. It was dark, I had to go through a  
forest and there was a dark figure behind me. I was very  
frightened.

My sister had promised to help me to do a translation from  
English into German. But the day I needed her she told me that  
she was busy - I was very angry.

Several years ago my mother died. She had been ill for a long  
time, but nevertheless her death came unexpectedly. I did not and  
I still do not want to believe that it is true.

I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the wood  
I saw the body of a slow-worm (without the head).

I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would  
never have said normally. Next morning I was terribly ashamed  
about what I had said.

An accident happened to my little cousin because I had not taken  
enough care of her. She fell on the floor and her hands were  
hurt.

I had a little cat which was very sick. As I liked it very much I  
went to a veterinary with it. He told me how to tend it and it  
really recovered its health. Everybody said that I had saved its  
life.

When I was a child, I had a terrible nightmare with St. Nicholas'  
Devil Servant. I asked my mother if he really existed and she  
said yes. The following nights I could not sleep and a  
light had to be left turned on.

As I usually do not start learning until a short time before an  
examination,, I once made up my mind to try to work for a longer  
time. But once again I did not do it - and got a bad mark.

A friend told me about his cousin who is my girlfriend. He said  
she had treated him in a mean and nasty way. I was surprised  
because in front of other people she had always treated him in a  
friendly way. I am very sad about it.

I went out with my sister, her boyfriend and his friend. I did  
not like this young man. But suddenly he overcame me and kissed  
me. He was very strong so that I could not defend myself.

During the oral part of my final examination I made a mistake in  
speaking so that all the teachers laughed at me.

There was a time when I did not get on well with my sister. I  
always grumbled at her and said bad things about her to my  
mother. So my mother always scolded her.
When I passed my final examination at school.

When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them  
and was afraid of losing my way in the cave.
When I felt being treated unjustly by a teacher.

When my grandmother died; I had a stronger relation to her than  
to my mother.
When I was molested by an old drunk man.
When I had a Latin examination in school.
When I had drunk too much and nearly got an alcohol poisoning.

When I met my girlfriend again in another town after a long  
separation.

When I went home alone early in the morning, I had to go through  
a wood.

A friend was unpunctual, we wanted to prepare ourselves for an  
examination.
When my grandparents moved to another part of the town.

At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered;  
blood was dripping on the floor.

In school I was very bad in running long distances and my  
class-mates laughed at me for this reason.

I had to take care of my little brother. When I met a friend I  
did not pay attention to him for a certain time and he was hurt  
while he was playing.

On my birthday, an old friend of mine sent me a card. I had not  
met him for a year and I was very glad that he had thought of me.

Once I spent a night with a friend at the secondary school. We  
told each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncanny  
noises. I was terribly frightened.

When we still attended school, my brother and I usually went to  
see our aunt and to show her our term's report. She rewarded us  
with money. Although my reports were as good as my brother's, he  
got more money.

My friend was pregnant, but lost her child during the second  
month. I went to see her at hospital - she was crying. I felt  
very sorry for her.

When I attended school, our class visited an institution for  
mentally and physically handicapped persons. Although I tried to  
control my feelings, I was disgusted.

After a party I spent the night with a friend. We both were  
drunk, the morning was disillusioning. A friend was me leaving  
the room and I felt shabby and immoral.

I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look after  
it all the time and the child fell down and was hurt. I felt  
guilty.

A very good friend of mine had been away for three months. When  
we met again, we ran up to each other and embraced.

One evening my father told me to go into the cellar and get him a  
beer. I was terribly frightened at the idea of a man sitting in  
the cellar and assaulting me. For my defence I took an empty  
bottle with me.

I had stolen a bottle of rum from a person who knows me well. He  
threatened to call the police if I did not pay 500 Shillings.

When my uncle died I saw a funeral for the first time. All people  
stood around the open grave and cried.

At a party I met a girl who drew me to her, told me some nonsense  
and always wanted to kiss me.

I put my head into the pullover of a girl to see her breasts. The  
girl looked at me so that I felt ashamed.

My uncle had promised to buy me a bicycle. As time went by and I  
had not received it yet, I asked my father to buy it for me.  
Later I heard that my uncle had wanted to offer me the bicycle on  
my birthday two weeks later.

Several days after my final examination at school, I was sitting  
in an airplane on my way to Greece. I enjoyed that moment very  
much.

One night I was lying in my bed awake but I had my eyes closed. I  
saw figures with terrible faces and black frocks bending over me  
and touching me. I opened my eyes but I could still see them. I  
had the feeling that somebody was in the room. It was terrible.  
Only when I turned on the light I was able to go to sleep.

I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car.  
We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my  
friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly  
started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for  
me to go to Carinthia.

Our dog had to be shot because he had killed a roe. I liked him  
very much and so I could not resign myself to that. I hated the  
hunter who shot him.

I was sitting in a station-hall and watching a lavatory  
attendant. She was very dirty. She started to eat something out  
of a dirty cup - it must have been something like lard. Then she  
took some breadcrumbs out of the pockets of her apron and ate  
them. I had to leave - I felt like vomitting.

I had to go to the doctor's because of a veneral disease. I told  
the doctor that I must have been infected by my boy-friend. This  
was not true, but I was ashamed to tell the truth.

When we were playing, I hurt my little sister, but towards my  
mother I did not admit that it was my fault.

My neighbour was not able to set his car in motion because it had  
snowed heavily. I helped him - he was thankful and invited me.

I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did not  
want to be left behind, so I braced myself and followed them.

At an examination I got a bad mark just because of a small  
mistake. When I went to the lector and wanted to talk about that,  
he did not listen to me but sent me away.

My cut was run over by a car. After searching for a long time I  
found her lying in a kerb. I was rather shocked and angry with  
the driver.

When I watched a report about El Salvador on TV, I saw people who  
had been murdered by terrible methods.

At a cross-country race I wanted to take a short-cut (which is  
not allowed). I was caught and disqualified. All my friends had  
observed that.

During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made it  
impossible to continue discussing.

On my birthday I got a present that I had desired for a long  
time.

When I am discussing something with a person and I realize that  
the other person is thinking over her own argumentations instead  
of listening, I become angry.

When we were on holidays my girl-friend had to leave me after 4  
weeks and I had to stay in Turkey for some more weeks because I  
had a job there.

I studied medicine for several semesters. I was always disgusted  
when we had the dissecting-course. I cannot understand why some  
persons like this course.

Some time ago we had a tournament in our tennis-club. For  
tactical reasons I was chosen to play against a much weaker  
player than I am. Although it would have been enough simply to  
win the game, I defeated him extremely. This would not have been  
necessary.

I had a discussion with my girl-friend. After some time we  
started to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I said  
that she was not as important to me as she might believe. Some  
time later I apologized for that.

On New Year's Eve I went in a disco with friends. I amused myself  
and got to know many other people.

I had to go to the dentist's. When he touched my tooth with his  
drill, I was terribly aftaid of the pain I would feel any moment.

I was very hungry and just wanted to start eating when a friend  
called me who usually talks for a long time. I was angry because  
I was prevented from eating.

My sister, whom I like very much, asked me for a favour which I  
refused her for some flimsy reason. Some time later I felt sorry  
for that and something like sadness.

On my way to a concert I went with a man who tried to molest me.  
At that moment I did not care much but now the impression fills  
me with disgust.

I asked my friend to come with me to a disco because I wanted to  
be with a person I know well. But when I amused myself with  
others I let my friend sit alone, although I had asked her to  
come.

I called my little sister to make her pick up her toy from the  
floor. When she still refused after I had asked her for the  
fourth time, we began to quarrel. At last the whole family was  
involved in this quarrel and trouble was brewing.

I had a singing-lesson, but I was not very good. The last  
exercise was singing scales. I did that very well and my teacher  
seemed satisfied.

A teacher wanted to instill a certain opinion and a certain  
behaviour into myself, what I refused. I was afraid when I saw  
him.

A friend had promised to call me at a certain time. I expected  
his call impatiently but in vain.

Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized for  
the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas  
Years ago.
A man whom I like, was drunk and tried to molest me.

It was the time when everybody spoke about and discussed  
Hainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed because  
I had no firm view of the whole thing and therefor was not able  
to join the conversation.

I was on a concert-tour and therefor seperated from my  
boy-friend. But I needed warmth which was given by a male member  
of the orchestra. My feelings towards him were not very deep, but  
his feelings were. I felt guilty when he said "I am not a  
radiator".

On my 18th birthday I passed the driving-test. I was glad because  
I had had to study very much, because I had been lucky and  
because - as a proof that it was really difficult - not everybody  
had passed the test.

At about midnight I had to go by bike through Graz alone. On the  
whole it was a distance of several kilometers. A car followed me  
through the streets. Only when I went into a one-way street the  
car disappeared. The rest of my way home I was very afraid.

I had studied for almost one week for my physics-examination.  
With difficulty I passed the examn. I was angry about the teacher  
and also about myself because I had not remembered enough during  
the examn and because the time that I spent studying was wasted.

I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and I  
cried for several days because I was so sad.

A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very  
disgusting, especially because I was eating.

At a carneval-party I smooched with a man - some days later I was  
rather ashamed for that.

By fun I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurt  
her unintentionally - and she ran out of the room, crying.

During my first week in Graz I met a girl who I had got to know  
in the train from Amsterdam to Graz. Although I had considered  
her very sympathetic, we had seperated without changing our  
adresses.

Many years ago I saw the film "Psycho" by Hitchcock for the first  
time. When I saw the film I was alone and afterwards I hardly  
dared to go to bed and hardly was able to sleep.

I had got a bad cold. My father said I must be crazy to go by  
motorbike at those temperatures. When I answered him that I did  
not care about a cold, he said that if I did not care for  
anything I could leave him (it was for the second time he said  
something like that).

I was at home alone when I realized that a young roe approached  
our house. I hid because I did not want to frighten it. It  
limped. Some time later, when I thought that it had already run  
away, I saw it lying on our terrace. I came nearer and saw that  
it was terribly wounded. I informed the ranger who said that the  
roe must have been attacked by dogs. He had to shoot it.

Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains for one  
week. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day my  
friend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner was  
terrible - nevertheless we all ate rather much and had an  
improper and unsavoury conversation.

My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of my  
grandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatory  
comments on him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man had  
died recently.

When I still went to primary-school, I went on a ski-trip with my  
family. After skiing we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenly  
my father said that he had forgotten something in the car. He  
gave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficulties  
with the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to help  
me. When she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no second  
key. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.

I had not studied very much for my final examination at school,  
so I had to take an additional examination in French. The oral  
examination was not very hard for me - the more I was glad when I  
heard that I had passed it.

When I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This is  
not a complicated operation, but just before it started I was  
very afraid so that I will never forget it.

My parents are divorced, father pays alimony for me. Two years  
ago my sister who lives with father, suddenly asked mother for  
money. As she considered the amount of money my mother offered  
her too small, she brought an action against mother. I was  
terribly angry with my sister.

I arranged with a friend to go skating the next day. He asked me  
to wake him up by telephone at twelve o'clock because we had come  
home late in the morning. Next day I called him - he was not at  
home. As something like that had happened to me several times  
before, I came to the conclusion that one cannot rely on anybody  
and I felt very sad.
Whenever I see a spider or a snake I feel disgusted.

When I had slept with a boy for the first time I felt ashamed for  
three reasons. First, because I was only 13 years old, second,  
because I did not really like him, third, because he had caught  
me napping.

I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years,  
when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal  
that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a  
bit guilty for what had happened.

My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of  
the life-saving dogs.

I was in a dark cellar and saw a glowing red point. I thought  
that it was a person with a cigarette - but it was only the red  
switch.

A man treated his dog very badly - he insulted and beated him  
until the dog kept lying on the floor with his tail drawn in.
A horse which I had liked very much was taken away.

On TV I saw a report about church in Amerika. A priest was shown  
who was performing miracles in front of the camera - I felt  
disgusted.

When I was a child, my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and  
ran out - I do not know the reason for that. My father came after  
me and insisted on my apologizing.

I quarreled with my boy-friend. He said it was unfair that I  
always started crying so that he had to give in.

To be able to prepare myself better for an important examination,  
I did not spend the nitht with my girl-friend but in the  
students' hostel. I had not done that for months. The day when I  
had the examn, somebody knocked at my door at seven o'clock in  
the morning. My girl-friend who likes sleeping late, had come to  
be able to be with me.

I studied medicine for several semesters and at that time I  
developed a great fear of examinations. I was most afraid of my  
examination of anatomy. While other students were examined, I was  
dissecting. I was able to hear everything and was waiting with  
fear until it was my turn.

When I come home in the evening, the first thing I do is to sit  
down and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totally  
desolate state. My girl-friend had wanted to tidy up but had not  
finished.

My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and  
take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for  
me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so that my own  
feelings were intensified.

When a very near person got into an awkward situation but showed  
only helplessness and indecision.

I spent an evening with my girl-friend. When we wanted to go to  
bed I was totally drunk. Next morning I felt rather ashamed.

I threw away an object, which belonged to a friend, because I did  
not know what to do with it. My friend was very sad about that  
and I felt guilty.
After a long time I saw my boy-friend again.
My first public appearance in front of a rathe big audience.

I was angry about how the government acted concerning Hainburg,  
especially when I saw a discussion about it on TV.
Death of my father
When I got indecent offers.

When I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant that  
I am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.

My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend  
himself very well; I should have taken his part.

I thought that I had failed an examination, but when I was  
informed about the mark, I saw that I had passed it.

Before an examination: I had the fealing that I had not learned  
enough.

Once when I was playing table tennis I was already sure that I  
would win , but at last I lost the game.
My grandfather's funeral.

In cinema I saw a film which showed how a person was torn out his  
guts when he was still alive.

I was sitting in a restaurant with friends. They asked me  
something which they thought I should know. Actually I know it,  
but at that time I was not able to remember it.

I had an appointment with a friend. I promised him to meet with  
him, but at last I did not without having informed him.

When I had a psychical crisis, I met a girl, who told me that she  
had had almost the same problems and how she had finally overcome  
them.

I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick  
caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars  
and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on  
my fingers. Out of the fear I was almost unable to climb down.

A friend of mine told other people that I was a slattern (because  
of an occurence that had happened some time ago). When I heard  
about that I was very angry.

My grandfather was seriously ill, he had only a few days left to  
live. I had always loved him, but never told him. When I saw him  
for the last time, I had the feeling that I had omitted so many  
things I could not do again. - There was a fly sitting on his  
forehead and he was too weak to drive it away. I was very sad  
when I saw that.

Normally my father never tells vulgar jokes, we do not speak  
about sexual things, too. But once he told such a vulgar joke,  
that I was really disgusted. He did not tell me, but some of his  
friends, but I was present.

When I was 6 or 7 years old, I pulled down the trousers of a  
friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother  
watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We  
never spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her as  
it was for me.

When I told my boy-friend, who loved me very much, that I wanted  
to put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told him  
that and also a long time after that I felt guilty, because I had  
hurt him so much.

Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much.  
Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within their  
group, although it was late in the evening.

After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I did  
not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was  
madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I  
told him to be cautious, but he did not care.

A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil when he is cooking. I  
am always angry about that, because it is an unnecessary luxury.  
Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again.  
When I had already put the oil into the pan, he poured it out  
again and put the butter into the pan.

After some friends had come to see me. They had stayed for  
several days and we had got on very well. When they had left, I  
had a feeling of emptyness.

I had a quarrel with a friend who lived with me in the same flat.  
He moved out. Before he went he invited me and some friends for a  
drink. At last he was totally drunk and smelled disgusting.  
Besides, he told lies about us and behaved as if he was to be  
pitied.

I went to see a friend. There were other people, too, and  
everybody brought some present. I was the onlyone who brought  
nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything  
- although I knew how he felt.

With a group of handicapped people we went to a party. When we  
wanted to leave we were not able to find one of these people. I  
had told his mother that we would leave at 4.30 p.m., actually it  
was planned for 3.30 p.m. Therefore there was a delay.

I had a quarrel with my fiancT. When he admitted his fault,  
everything was allright. It was then for the first time that he  
surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.

After my boy-friend had beaten me for the first time, I always  
trembled when somebody knocked on my door or when I heard steps  
coming nearer.

I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the fine  
for my fiancT. But he stayed in another town and spent one  
thousand shillings in the restaurant during the same time.
I had to give up my love, because it did not work out well.
I was insulted without a reason by a drunk man.

My boyfriend had drunk too much and beaten me. When I had to show  
the letter the door, which was almost crashed, I felt ashamed.

I spied on my fiancT and was terribly jealous. Later I saw that  
there was no reason for that.

My sister had a daughter. I saw the baby for the first time  
through a pane of glass and she looked at me.

My mother, my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and  
watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to  
turn off. When we did not do that he switched off the fuse and  
started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid  
that he would do us a harm.

I bought an aquarium which made me much pleasure. I was watching  
the fish when my father came in and asked me how much I had payed  
for it. He said he would not pay for the current that it would  
require.

When I was 9 years old, I got a cat, but after 3 days he died. I  
was very sad, because I had nursed him and taken him to the  
veterinary's - but in vain. Although I had had him only for a  
short time I had liked him very much.

When my grandmother was about 80 years old, she lived with us for  
several years. I saw her illness. I did not even want to breath  
the air that smelled of her presence.

I am left-handed. When I attended the first form, we learned to  
write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my  
friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was  
looking at my note-book. I was ashamed.

When I was 4, we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister and  
her friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. I wanted  
to arrive before them and went on a shorter, but more dangerous  
way. When I arrived, I found nobody there. I waited for a long  
time, but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who had  
been searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me, but I saw  
how much she had worried (herself).

When I was 17, I had a mystic vision. I melted into a dazzling  
light, which omitted perfect love. The physical experience became  
unimportant, I heard or saw the words "overcome egotism". The  
feeling of joy remained for month after that experience.

When we had swimming instruction, we had to take a header from  
the springboard. I usually refused to do that, but at least I was  
forced to.

When I played in a chess championship, I was disturbed by other  
people. I asked them to be quiet, but in vain.
When my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.

When I was a child, I was sometimes forced to eat things that  
disgusted me.

When I was 12 years old, some friends of our family had come to  
watch TV. I lay on the floor and moved my pelvis. When the other  
people had gone, my mother told me that it had looked as if I had  
wanted to make sex.

When I shirked the gymnastic lesson I met the director of our  
school who asked me what I was doing.

When I was in a situation which seemed hopeless for me, I moved  
back to my parents. For my father it went without saying anything  
(normally he ofter grumbles at me).

I lived in a flat with a couple. The woman was so jealous of me,  
that she sometimes had crying fits. Eventually her husband could  
not stand that any more and wanted to kill me.

I have a very big family. At my grandmother's funeral we all met  
and everybody pretended mourning. In reality it was like a  
fashion-show: everybody wanted to show himself.
Often a dog which is treated very badly by his owner comes to us.

After a pleasant evening with friends in my flat, one of them did  
not want to leave, because he wanted to sleep with me. He said  
that he had fallen in love with me, that he felt alone and so on.

I look up to my Karate-teacher. When I came to a training lesson  
after I had not trained for one week, I was totally stiff. I was  
ashamed.

My sisters asked me to fetch them at a discotheque which is 5 km  
off. There was a thick fog and snowfall. There was not enough  
room in the car for all of them and they asked me to go there  
once again. When I did not do that they had a way to make me feel  
guilty.

When I heard that I had passed my final examination at school  
(with success).
Before my final examination.
When my mother kept me in leading-strings.
When my father died.
When I worked at the life-saving sevice and saw the first exitus.
When I made a fool at an examination.

When I had wrongly explained someone an important exemple for an  
examination.

Last year I went to see friends in Yugoslavia - two girls with  
whom I get along very well.

Before I went to the urologist's I was afraid for several  
reasons: because it was for the first time, because the medical  
check-up might be painful, because of the uncertainty and because  
someone had informed me about it.

My girl-friend did not understand me; I was angry with myself  
because I had problems when we seperated - I could not resign  
myself to it.
A friend who was 22 years old died.

When I was in the army, we got a certain dish for dinner that I  
do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat, but I was very  
hungry.
I had to pay a fine because of speeding.

A friend who was 22 years old, died of leukemia; I had not known  
that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.
When we got a young dog.
I was afraid before I went to the doctor's.
I had an accident with damage to the car body.
My dog died of a cerebral tumor.

When I worked at the life-saving service I was disgusted by a  
patient whose outward appearance was distasteful.

When I was a child, I had a medical check-up. I had to undress  
myself and was examined by several doctors.

When a classmate wanted to sit down, I pulled his chair away, so  
that he was slightly injured.

When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long  
time, would come and see me.

When I had my first oral examination after a long time;  
especially one day before the examination when I had the feeling  
that I had not studied enough and had not enough time to make up  
for it.

I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room, although  
they had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.
When my brother died.

I read about a murderer who brutalized his victims by cutting  
open their stomaches and taking out their bowels.

When I was a child: I had told my mother a lie and she found it  
out.

My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and  
sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and  
when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad  
about that.
I unexpectedly got a present from my father.

When I had to go through lonely streets in the middle of the  
night.

My boy-friend had promised me to come home at about 10 p.m. He  
did not return until midnight and had consumed a lot of alcohol.
A relative, whom I like very much, left for the United States.

When I was walking on the street, I slipped on the dung of a dog.  
I did not fall down, but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on my  
sole.

Some persons, who are important for me, came to see me and I had  
not washed the dishes.

I was looking after my cousin's little daughter; she fell down,  
was slightly injured and cried vociferously.

I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long  
time.

I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that  
country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.

A friend had promised to get me a book which was very important  
for my work, but she forgot it.

My dog, whom I had had for eleven years, died. I watched his  
soporification.

A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately I  
was able to break loose.

When I stayed on a nudism beach, a man was watching me in a  
disagreeable way. I had the feeling that he was examining my  
body.

I had a quarrel with my father. He was depressed, because  
somebody had treated him injustly. As we had an argument, it was  
impossible for me to help him.

My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at  
the station.

After a motor accident (I was the frong-seat-passenger) I spit  
blood.

At an office an application that I had made was turned down  
because of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.
My uncle died - I felt sad at the funeral.

I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her  
awfully.

After an oral examination I shook the professor's hand, but he  
had only stretched it out for my ball-point-pen.
I spread abroad an intimate secret.

I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I  
was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.

My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my  
girl-friend had fallen in love with another man, I was afraid to  
lose her.

I was angry when I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiers  
dropped out.

During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit  
suicide. She had just left hospital, her lips were trembling, she  
looked miserable.

On my way home in the middle of the night I saw a drunk man and a  
woman who were quarreling, beating each other, shouting and so  
on. I felt disgusted especially because they treated each other  
in such a degrading way.

My girl-friend and I live in one flat with another couple. We get  
along very well and usually we share everything. Once we two were  
sitting in our room and eating a cake when the others came in.

I was on a visit to friends who have a baby. The baby was crying  
in another room, but soon it became quieter and it seemed that it  
would fall asleep. I went into the room where the baby was lying  
- and it started crying again.

I went to fetch my girl-friend at the station. When the train  
arrived and I saw her descending and running up to me, I felt  
glad.

When I wanted to go into a house, there was suddenly a big dog  
standing beside me. It was hardly moving, but I did not know how  
it would react later on.

My father had bought too many goods for his shop, there was not  
enough space to store them.
A friend died of cancer when he was 18 years old.

At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions and  
the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression  
on me.

During a discussion I said something rather stupid and  
unnecessary.

When I was driving my car, I wanted to pick something from the  
floor of the car and drove into the guide-rail. I thought that I  
should not have done that and felt guilty.

On my birthday a friend came to see me unexpectedly and brought  
me flowers. I usually do not see her very often.

I was awakened by a dream in the middle of the night. I dreamt  
that a stranger was in my house.

My boy-friend had promised me to come an 10 a.m. - he was 3 hours  
late.
When I heard about a murder of a 16-year-old girl.

When I broke the piggy bank of my brother and my mother  
discovered that.

I was sitting in a restaurant with friends and I knew that in the  
meantime my girl-friend must have come to my flat and found the  
door closed.

After I had been away for a long time a friend told me that I had  
passed all my written examinations.

Recently my younger brother disappeared for two days without  
leaving a trace. Usually he tells me when he wants to do  
something like that, therefore I was afraid that something had  
happened to him.

I played chess with my 12-year-old brother. I made a stupid  
mistake - and he won!

It was only once that I really felt sad: at my grandfather's  
funeral (after a long time of suffering he had died of cancer).

3 years ago I served in the army. Once a collegue denounced me  
because of a delict, which is usually committed. I was arrested  
for 3 days. I still detest this man.

Once I went home totally drunk and roused all our neighbours from  
sleep.

When I was in the puberty I smashed the favourite toy of my  
little brother because of a fit of rage.

After I had had a disappointment in my private life, my friend,  
who studies in Vienna, came to see me spontaneously.
Before an oral examination - which I did not take eventually.

A friend had promised me to give me a lift to Graz. To be sure I  
called her before we went. She told me that she had just promised  
another person to give him a lift.
I am sad because some relations to friends are not very good.

I think I have hardly had a situation where I felt disgusted.  
Perhaps once, when I saw a big spider.
When my boy-friend left me and I wanted to persuade him to stay.

I promised my mother to come home on her birthday, but at last I  
was prevented. Nevertheless it would have been possible to go but  
I did not.
Seeing relations from overseas after a few years.

Unknown person knocking repeatedly on backdoor when no one else  
was at home.
Boyfriend "chatting up" another girl.
A friend breaking up with her boyfriend.

Accidentally seeing a friend in a compromising situation with a  
stranger.
Parents finding out I smoked.
Not thanking relatives for a favor done.
Emotional reassurances by spouse.
Movement in bush late at night while camping.
Heated discussion with spouse concerning new house.
Loss of close relative.
The price I was charged for work on my car.
Caused fault in V.C.R. by not following instructions carefully.
Losing my temper with my spouse.
A night spent with a group of friends.

A car came very close to hitting me whilst I was crossing the  
street.

A friend whom I had gone out of my way to do something for did  
not bother to acknowledge my efforts, and treated me badly  
thereafter.

A girlfriend ended our relationship in an abrupt and unexpected  
manner.

A friend once reacted childishly (he is 23 yearrs old) to my not  
responding in his favour to a request, that is: he asked me for  
some money I refused, and his reaction was quite childish.

On one occasion whilst engaging in horseplay with my girlfriend,  
I caused her to be physically harmed.

I borrowed money from a friend and did not pay back the debt when  
I said I would.
Getting a phone call from a very old friend.
Before giving a seminar to a rather large audience.

Being stopped by the police for a traffic offence which I don't  
think I committed.
Death of a parent.

At a social event when none of the guests would help to serve  
food or clear tables. It was all beneath them.

The mother of a small child found me shaking the child in  
exasperation, because I couldn't get it to sleep.

The more than satisfactory result of a recently-completed  
university subject was communicated to me by phone.

I was a passenger in a jumbo-jet which was accelerating down the  
runway and almost at the point of take-off, when the pilot  
suddenly braked and put the engines into reverse thrust, in an  
obviously urgent attempt to stop the aircraft. The hostesses show  
signs of concern and my first thought was that something was on  
the runway in our path and that we were in danger of hitting it.

A person walking his dog allowed it to defecate on the footpath  
outside my house. Although it had happened before, this was the  
first time I had witnessed it. All the skills I had learnt from  
PY 263 were thrown out the window when his indifference to my  
protestation was obvious to me.

While walking through an old mining area, I unwittingly disturbed  
a wallaby which, in its resultant flight, accidentally fell down  
a deep mine shaft. On investigation it seemed uninjured, but it  
was impossible for the wallaby to get out, and also for me to get  
it out of the shaft. To prevent its suffering a slow death, I  
shot it.

A colleague and I were sitting on a bench next to an old man in a  
shopping centre. the old man coughed and spluttered somewhat,  
then with his fingers removed the resultant phlegm and mucous  
from his mouth, and transferred it onto the armrest of the  
bench.

I had promised to contact a friend about a particular matter by a  
certain date, then thought no more about it until the friend  
reminded me after the date had passed.

A neighbour complained about smoke from my backyard incinerator  
entering his house after a change of wind direction. I lit the  
fire after originally checking that the wind would not blow the  
smoke in that direction.

On my birthday, when a very close friend sent me a huge bouquet  
of flowers.

When I heard that there had been some women raped at uni, just  
near where I usually park my car and walk by myself at night.  
Although I wasn't in danger it unnerved me for days and I was  
fearful whenever walking through the area.

When the person I am going out with let me down in a situation  
that I was depending on them, and didn't show respect or care.

When I found out that a person I went to school with had died in  
a car accident.

When I heard about the way a parent of a friend had mistreated  
him, and caused a great instability.

When I realised that I had become too emotionally involved with  
the person I'm going out with, and when I began to like someone  
else and questioned whether I really care about person I'm with.

When I came very late one night (or morning !) and my parents  
were waiting, not so much angrgy as disappointed.

One of my friends and I had breakfast in a restaurant. It was  
spontaneous and lots of fun.

I was walking home late at night from lectures and someone  
deliberately started following me. It was dark and I was scared.

At one of my close friends saying she didn't like the way I am  
nice to people I don't know, or who have been nasty to me.

Leaving Melbourne to move interstate - leaving relatives and  
friends behind.

Disgust at a girl I know for continually feeling sorry for herself  
and never acting positively to do something about her problems.

I am ashamed of the horrible way I used to treat my little  
sister.
Often I forget to give my immediate family birthday presents.

I noticed that Meryl Streep and I had similar cheekbones and jaw  
structure.
I do not recall being scared in the near past.
As for disgust.

Girl I was fond of did not initiate conversation as I expected in  
tutorial.

I realised that someone was insidiously attempting to shit me off  
I was disgusted with him for doing so, because I afforded him  
with no excuse to do so.

I do not seem to feel emotion such as shame, guilt or fear - far  
out !

I cannot recall feeling guilty in the near past.
REMARK - SUBJECT MAY NOT HAVE TAKEN THE EXERCISE VERY SERIOUSLY.
When I was complimented and called "delightful".
When my mother was angry with me over my friends and boyfriend.
Anger towards my lover for being late.
The death of my twin sister - suicide.

Disgust with myself for consistently making foolish errors in  
communicating with others (asking for 1/2 Kg of nuts when I only  
wanted 50 g).

I had been rude to my mother at a time when she needed  
comforting, not anger (death of my sister).

Guilt - because I had not written to my sister for months before  
she died.

My current lover and I had been very busy with work and study and  
had not had time alone together for almost a month until one  
afternoon recently when we made love for hours and then showered  
and ate together.

A workmate and I had been antagonistic with each other for some  
weeks - he had reacted violently to my criticisms of his work  
standards.

I had been having a heated argument with a lover - whose  
intention was that we should marry in the near future - and was  
rejected by her when I started to cry. When I stopped crying for  
a moment she said "There, have you got it all out now ?".

I was alone in my parents' house, having made plans to spend the  
afternoon with a lover (plans which the lover cancelled),  
watching a movie and considering my life and circumstances -  
pressures of examinations in particular.

I discovered some pornographic literature in a workmates drawers.  
The literature featured pictures of naked women defecating on one  
another.

Upon returning from a journey of about two weeks duration, I  
found that a collection of pornographic literature had been  
removed from my room I had previously thought that no one was  
aware of the existence of this material.

My mother and father had forbidden me to ride my scooter on the  
road, and I had transgressed (together with the "wild" kids from  
across the street) by riding my scooter down a steep hill near  
our house. My mother sent the boy next door to collect me, and I  
was severely scolded.
Blank.

After going through a glass door, I sustained a number of serious  
cuts which were gaping open.

The mother of a person with whom we had been sharing a housing  
accused me of trying to rip her off over payment of bills in the  
house.

Watching "11 am". They had a programme on the starving refugees.  
Their plight was a source of sadness for me.

A girl with whom I was staying having sex with a person for about  
3 nights running, and then with his brother the following night,  
and back again.

During an argument an acquaintance accused me of having insulted  
her parents by having had sex in their house which they  
overheard.

A girl whom I hadn't seen for a period of time told me that she  
had been pregnant and had an abortion - I was the father.

When my boyfriend last told me he loved me after I gave him an  
impulsive kiss.

When my boyfriend was leaving to go home one night, I had a very  
deep sense of uneasiness and an unwarranted fear that I wouldn't  
see him again.

Anger with boyfriend's best friend for alienating me and blaming  
me for personality changes in my boyfriend and changes in my  
boyfriend's attitude to him and his obvious egoistical attitude  
himself in doing so. I also lost one of my best friends - his  
girlfriend.

Death of paternal grandmother to whom I was very close - died of  
cancer.

Disgust with oneself after being intoxicated enough to go to bed  
with a stranger.

I feel shame every time I think of very dear friends of mine  
abroad who were family to me for a year, and now 2 years later, I  
have attempted, but have not actually gone through with  
corresponding with them, to express my feelings and gratitude.

After being told that an ex-boyfriend had been hurt by my wearing  
something he had given me when I was with another guy. I was  
unaware of my actions really, as I had not considered the fact  
that he had given it to me, and might see me. I still respected  
his opinions of me.

When I thought that my high school love and I had a mutual  
emotion.

I was on my surf ski. Rather large waves to strong current  
separated me from my ski and we both began to drift slowly  
(actually rather quickly) away to sea. The direction I was  
drifting in was taking me straight over a reef on which rather  
large sharks were constantly being caught. (I was alone with no  
one to help me).

I was enjoying the company of bird life while I was eating lunch  
in a park when a group of people began throwing sticks at some of  
the birds - for no reason other than the satisfaction of seeing  
them being scared away.

When I left my sister's house after staying there for a few days.  
She has two little boys, and they are very warm people (the  
family). At the time, I was in need of this sort of contact, and  
I grew very fond of children (no, I'm not a paedophiliac).
When my father revealed inconsistent morals.

When I woke up after a night of drinking I couldn't remember and  
discovered several untoward things had occurred.

Leaving home when my mother thought I had no reason to go and  
felt that I was rejecting her. She is a constantly depressed  
person (a bit of a worry-wort) and I felt guilty about having  
given her this additonal problem.
I'd just got the top mark in an exam.

My brother and I were driving to Brisbane when he drove back onto  
the road, perhaps cutting off another car but not noticeable -  
this driver did his best to drive us off the road for about 1/2  
an hour.

I was at the corner shop, which I patronise regularly I had only  
a $ 50 note and I purchased about $ 3 worth of goods that I  
really needed - the keeper made sarcastic remarks to others about  
people using him to cash notes.

My mother died of cancer after a 4 year illness - I think the  
most pregnant moment of sadness was the next morning, just as the  
sun rose.
A lecturer in great detail spoke about his sexual experiences.

I was walking outside the union refec after rain when I tripped  
and fell.
I stole 5c from my mother's purse for a choo-choo bar - I was 6.

On a sailing boat at night, under a full moon, listening to Pink  
Floyd, drinking good wine, with good company, the boat being  
steered by autopilot, and a full eclipse of the moon.
Fear of sexual overtures from a close relative in the family.

When my rights to use a shared house had been usurped by  
co-owners out of pure selfishness.

At rejection / being ignored by a loved person held in great  
esteem.
Viewing the nuclear war film "Threads".

Following heavy stirring / ridiculing a close friend who was  
very vulnerable to such attack - inspiring fierce, defensive  
counter-attack.

Guilt at having pressed another person to expose/explore his  
personal weaknesses/faults, to the extent that the other person  
was made to feel terrible/defensive.
Family member survived an operation.

I was walking to my car at night and thought that I was being

I walked in on a teenage patient of mine (I work in a hospital)  
as he was going through my office drawers and he had removed  
money from my purse.
Death of grandmother.
When I became aware that an acquaintance had stolen from friends.
Caught cheating on a diet.
I had shown anger toward my dog and he was killed later that day.
A close married friend has just had his first child.

Stranded in the north of Fraser Island with a submerged 4 WD hire  
vehicle.

Not being alowed on a school camp with the class I'd been in for

At the funeral of a friend about 20 years old, who was killed in

A female friend was violently ill on the return journey from a

Cheating in a minor geography exam at school.

I wasn't able to see my girlfriend on her birthday and because I

Having received an offer to do post-graduate work.

Taking a trip to crocokile country I fell out of the boat and was

Last night - finding that someone in the house had eaten an

The loss of my father as he died of a massive and sudden heart

When after a party celebrating a friend's 21st birthday - upon  
leaving I found 10 people outside throwing up and further 4

Having had a very heated argument with my sister - I began

A situation where I stole a friends wife's wallet.

Winning a tight tennis match. One set to play, and the team was

When at school, I threw a duster at another child and hit him in

Finding that a subordinate at work was still not willing to

Death of the family dog.

We had friends to dinner and one of them threw a beer bottle in

After making a joke about a friend's marriage that was too  
personal.

Carried out a vandalistic act on some windows at an old army

Arriving in New Zealand as a teenager - first overseas trip -

As a child (i.e. 5-7) hiking in reasonably rugged bush and

Following an argument with my brother, he broke my golf clubs.

Leaving the house myself and a female friend had shared for 6-8  
months because of the friendship which developed and our approach

Discovering a good friend had lied to me, resulting in a

No specific instances - perhaps having lied as a child resulting

Leaving University in 1982 following exclusion and lying to

Going to a friend's wedding and seeing many of my old friends

Car accident. Travelling as a passenger along narrow bitumen road

At school when I had a shouting argument with a friend over my

Looking up end-of-semester results, and finding I'd failed three

When I found out some family friends were embezzelling the

When my best friend foud out I'd been lying about something I'd

After having told an authority figure a very large lie I was told

After being away on a holiday for 2 months, a friend, who lived

Walking along with a dog barking at you and following you.

Doing a group assignment and being left to do all the work and

After training for an Australian championship competition for a  
year and then injuring myself 2 weeks before the competiotion.
Someone ruining someone's property just for the fun of it.

A friend giving me an expensive Christmas gift while I gave her a

Talking about someone behind their back.

I was captain of the school swimming team. The team was only two  
points in front before the last relay. We won the relay, which I

I was in about Grade 7, I came home from school one day and was told

Brother provoked anger. It was when mother and father were away

Shifted from Melbourne to Brisbane. All my old school friends

Was picking up my father from work and on passing through the  
Valley watched three prostitutes walk up and down waiting for

Had a very good friend. We grew apart I found myself running her

Guilt after fighting with my sister (for) telling her how bad she

When I won the "Under 18" Showjumping at the Brookfield Show. The

When I was on holiday, walking back to where I was staying, at

When my mother and father split up I was angry: I felt deprived

I was terribly upset when my kitten got hit by a car. He didn't

When I heard that one of my good friends, when at a party, had

When I hadn't studied for an exam, so I pretended to be sick so I

When I was young, I stole some money from my mother's purse. It

Day I received my T.E. score and acceptance into my chosen course.
First day at University (I didn't know what to expect).

At a school dance when my supposed "best friend" kept walking

At end of school - function to "celebrate" ? Leaving friends who

While watching a film of an experimental operation on a cat's

When my mother asked me to do a job for her which does not

After having been told not to take the car, I took it anyway and

Eating biscuits and drinking Milo (Chocolate energy drink made

Going to a disco by myself to wait for some friends. We had

A person ignored my advice, did not pay any attention to what was

A friend of mine is having psychiatric problems because of his

At school, when the only thing people my age could think of was getting

A girl I was with yelled something out to this group of guys I

I didn't tell my parents exacly what had made me so late in

Getting a good mark for a subject I had worked hard at but

When cleaning up a pile of junk under our house, a huge spider (a

At the hardware store, trying to convert Imperial to Metric

My father died last year after an 8-week severe illness.

During the PY 102 film session on Tuesday, one of the films shown

Several years ago I was caught riding the train without a ticket.

I was walking quite quickly and unthinking through a children's

I got a good reaction from my tutor and tutorial group for a

A man was yelling outside my window at 3.00 am, yelling threats,

Going away for the weekend, leaving my College room open - when I

Passing away of my father.

At a party where the boys were telling revolting stories about

Getting slightly intoxicated at the 1984 I.C.C. Ball.

I felt guilty about going out when I should have been studying

Walking around the University at night by myself, having been

When I received the mark well above requirements for the course I

When I left all my friends at school (break up) knowing we would

At my father, when he yelled and accused my sister's friend (over

When I was little and didn't own up to placing a lolly on the

I felt guilty when I skipped a two hour practical class I knew I

Got through first semester University.

In a situation whereby a friend's actions were deliberately

I broke up with my boyfriend of seven months, but it was a very

A situation where I ignored my beliefs and principles for a trip

I bacame involved with a boy for a very brief moment not because

Ignoring my parents'wishes.
Getting back with my boyfriend after a year away - apart.
Having my luggage checked at Customs.
When a friend wouldn't speak to me and wouldn't tell me why.
Thinking about friends overseas.
Hearing of a filthy situation over the phone.
Sending pictures home when I'd put on so much weight.

When I opened my TE Score envelope, and saw I got into

When I was accused of "bitching" about best friend.

At our Senior dinner - separated from school friends, nothing

At a night club watching little tarts trying to earn a living.

When I was little - Mum caught me telling a lie about who broke

When I used to tell Mum I was going somewhere else than where I

When my brothers had passed all of their exams and were able to

When I was caught in an elevator and it got stuck between floors.

When I have seen people very drunk and making fools of

When my friends were rude to a girl.
When I was rude to my mother and got angry with her.

When somebody broke into our home one night when my mother was

When I saw a male engineer one year and came back to find he was

On holidays - just driving along a road beautiful scenery. Just

Lying to a friend about something that was trivial.

Good news about a sick relative.
Walking in the dark by myself.
Getting terrible meals, but paying heaps for them.

Felt it after I spoke terribly (got mad at) the person who is the

Not giving up something for Lent.

Every time I see a spider or a snake.

Can't remember specific event - besides just being moderately

Can't remember exact example.

A person that eat half of a cockroach in a cake without knowing

A situation where we were the center of attention, and things

end.

I felt it when I received a letter telling that I had been  
classified in a national concourse of p... I felt happy and  
vanity about it.

I felt fear when once I was asleep and dreamed that I was dying  
asfixiated by a cardiac attack, I was afraid and woke up  
desperate. Altough I wasn't afraid of death I was afraid.

I feel it when I see that somebody is traying to made a stupid of  
me.

I felt it when I was at home and saw a discussion without sense  
between my parents.

When I see all the putridness of people. The fact is the catarrh  
and spits that whash the streets of S.Paulo.

I felt it when I felt that I was being observed as an object of  
pleasure (sexual) when I opened and took off a shirt in a  
classroom at P.V.C.

I felt it when playing I pushed my brother and he fell down  
cutting himself in pieces of tile.
When I asked my girlfriend to marry me.

When I almost drowned myself in the municipal swimming pool that  
I use to go almost not excaping.

I was with my girlfriend when some guys that I don't like made  
fuss at my girl.
The death of my grandfather.

To go through the underground way at suburb station of LAPA. Poor  
people and the ambulants badly dressed up in a passage badly  
kept.

In a fight with my girlfriend in a luncheonette where everybody  
stared at me in such a way that I had to leave it.
I pointed a failure of a friend of mine.
When I met a friend that I hadn't seen for some time.
When I got in jungle where there was a great number of snakes.
When an unknown person provoked me verbaly and physically.
When my team lost a championship.
A dirty person, smelling bad and unknown laying on me.
I confused a girl with another.

Once when I complained I caused a great discussion between my  
parents.

When I began to date a boy with whom I am till now. This was 16  
months ago.
I learned that my girlfriend had been unjustly missed from work.
I got separated from the man I loved.

An acquaintance of mine revealed himself in a light unexpected to  
me.

Once as a school girl I was copying at a class work and my  
teacher spotted me.

I was in a sanatorium. In front of me a boy fell down from his  
invalid's chair. I could help him but I didn't. I felt like being  
paralysed.

When I took my entrance exams successfully and also when I got my  
school leaving certificate because the delivering ceremony was  
extremely official.

When I was to sit for my first entrance exam. I had fear of a  
possible failure.

I was indignant at the unimpartiality shown by the referees at  
the football match between Bulgaria and France.
When I got separated from the man I loved so much.

When I was watching some scenes from the Bertoluchi's film  
"Twentieth Century".
When I was a school girl and I copied at a class work.

When I have sometimes been unfair to my parents, when I have  
happened to deceive them over some trifling things.
When I was admitted to the Sofia University.
When I come home late at night.
When I talk to silly, petty-minded and unmanageable people.
When my friend (girl) went abroad for two years.
When I happen to witness some sadistic acts.
When I have a plain appearance.
When someone is accused or punished instead of me.
I was admitted to the University and a niece was born to me.
I was bitten by a dog.
My grandfather's funeral.
I was alone at home on New Year's Eve.
I was on a walk with my child when I met a drunk woman.
I was unaware that I had walked the streets in torn trousers.

Once I worked as a designer. A fitter was hard hit in a damage  
that occurred at the building site I had designed.
My admittance to the University.
A grenade blew out next to me.
An unjust calumny concerning me.
Unrealisation of the desired profession (aviator).
Disgust with a subordinate.
I lied to a friend.
Betraying someone's trust.
Friend's fiancT left her for me.
Winning Queensland Chess Championship.

When in a car accident where car was total wipe off (wipe out, or  
write off).
With self at losing an important game that I should have won.
Death of grandfather (unexpected).

Someone smoking on Electric train (Electric trains are  
non-smoking) with alcohol smell coming from person.
When bathing at surf beach & lost togs.

Promising someone to do their job and then not being able to do  
it due to transport troubles.

Receiving a very personal letter from a lady that I like, which  
revealed that she was more enthusiastic about me than I had  
thought possible.
Introducing myself at a first tutorial this year at University.

I was angry at a University tutorial when an ignorant loudmouth  
persisted in trying to dominate the conversation.

I left my home in Melbourne to come to Q'land to study and before  
I hopped in the car I hugged my mother and shook hands with my  
father. Sensing immediately my father's sadness, I also had a  
flood of the same emotion.
When one of my parents verbally, personally abused the other.

I felt something akin to shame after a heavy night of drinking,  
along with waking up with a woman I had just met whose husband  
was an epileptic. I was later to know that she knew my mother.

I felt guilty about talking negatively, and agreeing with a  
person who was doing likewise, about a non-present third person.
Being in love for the first time.

As a child - stepping on a rusty nail - being told that I might  
get tetanus.

As a child - about 8 years old - walking across a paddock - being  
set upon by another boy who claimed it was "his land" - being  
intimidated by the boy - crying, being punched, etc.
As a child - having a dog - it getting a disease and dying.

Being in a Malaysian city with my girlfriend coming out of a  
picture theatre - seeing her rush up to a taxi that a very old  
sick man was trying to get to. Seeing her take over the taxi.

As a child - being sent to the shop by mother - buying some  
chocolate - getting caught by mother.

As a child - accidentally stepping on a pet guinea-pig - it  
dying.

When I achieved my first 6 at University after a long string of  
3's, 4's and 5's (7 is the highest mark awarded, 3 is a conceded  
pass).

One night going downstairs, and hearing a strong stirring of  
brances, which was not the wind.

I was informed by my flatmate that, when we'd moved into our  
flat, she'd expected us to buy our food separetely - this event  
actually happened some 5 months after our sharing began. Prior to  
this, she had said nothing.

Having to decide on a termination of a pregnancy, after  
discussing it with friends, family and the man involved.

When a friend didn't invite her own parents to her Graduation  
ceremony.

Saying something quite rude, but in jest, about a photograph of  
someone, but it didn't quite turn out that way.

When I was about 14 years old, I "borrowed" a can of drink from  
the refrigerator, intending to replace it later that day. But it  
was found missing before I could do anything - no one owned up to  
its disappearance.

When I was a child, my beloved cat gave birth to four beautiful  
little kittens. Before she had them, she came up to me and I  
followed her out, then witnessed them being born.

On embarking on University life. I came from a different city and  
did not know anybody at the Uni. I was frightened because my well  
known and loved friends, also all my security had been taken  
away.

When my brothers were being cruel to my boyfriend, because his  
flat-mate bent back one of my brother's fingers. It wasn't his  
fault.

Upon moving away from home for the first time to a different  
city, I felt no longer "under the wing" of my parents even though  
they would always be there to help me. I felt a sense of loss, I  
was now all alone in the world, responsible for my own actions.

I was sitting at a rock concert, listening to an extremely loud  
band. A tiny baby in a crawler had been left by his young mother,  
right out in the sun next to a speaker, and was screaming -  
probably in pain.

Because I was lazy and unthoughtful I did not get into contact  
with a very close friend when she shifted from the Gold Coast to  
Brisbane, for a month, despite her efforts to contact me. I felt  
shamed when I finally confronted her again.

When I felt I had let my parents down, especially my mother, by  
having sexual intercourse for the first time, and a few times  
after that. Also, when I went on the Pill.

The weekend after I argued with my parents I went home again and  
they couldn't have been nicer. As soon as I walked in, Mum kissed  
me, then Dad, and thanked me for the birthday presents I'd left  
for him, including a very sentimental birthday card.

Before Uni started, I had to leave home and take up residence in  
Brisbane (the "big smoke") leaving home, my family, and moving to  
such a big place was quite intimidating at first, and I was  
anxious about it.

My flatmate was asking questions about my relationship with my  
boyfriend, whether I wasn't treating him as unfairly as I claimed  
he'd been treating me. As a result, I was angered, and became  
defensive.

A very close friend from Victoria visited me over the holidays.  
Having enjoyed his company immensely over 10 short days, I was  
overwhelmed by sadness when he left to return to Victoria.

One of my flatmates and I came back to the flat Monday morning,  
to find a real Mess, left by the guy we share with.

First weekend back home after one week at Uni I scolded one of my  
sister's best friends for using our telephone. Very silly, but I  
was annoyed because she was there at a time when I needed to be  
with my family.

When my Bictorian "friend" was staying at my house we ere going
